entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: wow

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah it had to do with stress and things like that i do not talk about that much other than those around me that are close to me if i meet someone new i do not just openly say well you know i have experienced this this and this so i just basically if it comes up i will not deny it or if it comes up and if it is if it i feel like it is something to talk about i will talk about it

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay sometimes when i am feeling tense i turn on the fish tank screensaver hey i know it is not hawaii but it is the best i have got what do you do to relax

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: actually my relaxation is i am currently living with my mom my mother and she is a senior citizen and she is alone so what i do for relaxation or to relieve stress is i actually help help her do yard work take care of all the gardening and things like that and that is actually very therapeutic you know

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: aw how are you at controlling your temper

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i am not i am not a short fused kinda person it takes a lot to get me really angry so as far as my temper is concerned there is not there is not much to that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i am trying to think here i can not recall when the last time it was but it was probably last year sometime when i had a creditor that i was dealing with being very difficult to work with and i owed money as far as some medical expenses that were incurred when i had my heart attack a few years ago and they were not very understanding of the situation and i i really got a little upset about that because i felt like i was being honest with them and i was i was more than willing to take care of my issues but they were playing hardball and i did not care for that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah that sucks

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it does

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about the hardest decision you have ever had to make

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: probably the hardest xxx decision i ever had to make was it had to do with a life and death situation with my my stepfather who was battling prostate cancer and yeah making a decision with my mother whether to proceed with a procedure that was gonna either help him or there was a slight chance it was gonna help him even though he was pretty terminal at that point or it would it would kill him you know and that was really tough it was really tough decision to make but you know i i felt like if i did not try and see if we could save his life help save his life or if it we did not take a chance and and take that extra step that i would regret it in the long run

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah that sounds really hard

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it is it was

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about your relationship with your family

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well right now i am separated from my wife so she has her issues i have my issues but we are not divorced we are just separated and we still have a relationship where we still speak to each other we just do not live together and the relationship with my mother is really great you know she is very understanding i am an only child so she likes having me around which is good because she is in her late she is in her later stage of her life she is eighty two years old

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: wow

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and and so she needs to i guess it is good that in in in it is own way maybe fate has taken place because you know eh someone eighty two years old by themselves in a huge house is not a good thing but with me there i think she feels there is a comfort level she feels with me there especially being her only child

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah what is something you feel guilty about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: probably the most guilty i feel about anything are are the things that i did to hurt my marriage as far as the things that i did the selfish things that i did when i was much younger that obviously affected the relationship between myself and my wife

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: can you give me an example of that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah i got caught up in a situation where i was working tremendous amounts of hours under a lotta stress my wife was also working a lotta hours in a job that she had and we were growing apart and when she was away my form of release was to go to the casinos and gamble and so you know i spent a lot of time in in the casinos and what eventually happened was i spent a lot of money and obviously that was a major issue regarding our relationship had to do with trust because it it was devastating to my wife

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah how did you feel in that moment

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i felt when when it when it came to light i felt very guilty and i felt less than a han being at that point in my life

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: i am sorry have you ever been diagnosed with ptsd

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no not at all

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you been diagnosed with depression

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no not really no

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i do not have problems sleeping that is i i do not ever recall having any problem sleeping so no

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is good do you feel down

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no not at all

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you noticed any changes in your behavior or thoughts lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no i well i just the only thing i could say is after i had my heart attack a few years ago i do not let i find myself not letting the small details or small things in life bother me as much as they did before so i tend to be a little bit more easygoing and my friends and family have noticed that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is great tell me about the last time you felt really happy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: the last time i felt really happy probably when i had a visit with my cardiologist after my heart attack and he basically said to me that after many tests and many months of rehabilitation that he was happy to explain to me that there was no scar tissue no major scar tissue that had occurred with my heart because of my heart heart attack and that i could count on living a pretty much normal life as long as i watched my diet and took my medications

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is so good to hear what are some things you wish you could change about yourself

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well i guess nber one thing is my physical being itself i like to be a little bit more healthier lose some more weight just in general just be more healthier physically and as far as mentally just not go back to those ways of thinking where i was doing the wrong things instead of the right things and not to be so selfish

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how do you cope with them

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: just one day at a time you know i just try to be at peace with my myself and try to have some peace of mind on a daily basis i meditate i read you know i read some books i watch tv i i do things that i know that if i can i if i can help myself i do things to help myself
